intro: Psychotria bremekampiana, commonly known as the Bremekamp's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the rainforests of Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found growing in shaded, humid environments, typically in the undergrowth of dense forests. The plant is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as psychotrine.
